abstract: Government officials and Apple representatives showed no sign of compromise in their battle over encryption and privacy, as they appeared before a congressional panel.
snippet: Government officials and Apple representatives showed no sign of compromise in their battle over encryption and privacy, as they appeared before a congressional panel.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The F.B.I. defended its hiring of a third party to break into an iPhone used by a gunman in last year’s San Bernardino, Calif., mass shooting, telling some skeptical lawmakers on Tuesday that it needed to join with partners in the rarefied world of for-profit hackers as technology companies increasingly resist their demands for consumer information.

headline.main: F.B.I. Says It Needs Hackers to Keep Up With Tech Companies
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Says It Needs Hackers to Keep Up With Tech Companies’ Encryption

byline.original: By Cecilia Kang and Eric Lichtblau
